Sentencas: The present study focuses on uncertainties existing in porous media parameters and in the inlet reactant mixture conditions of solid oxide fuel cell off-gas combustion.
Titulo: Calculation of premixed combustion within inert porous media with model parametric uncertainty quantification

Sentencas: Propagation of uncertainty from the model input parameters to the output stochastic variables is quantified using a non-intrusive spectral projection method based on polynomial chaos expansion.
Titulo: Calculation of premixed combustion within inert porous media with model parametric uncertainty quantification

Sentencas: The non-intrusive nature of this method allows the solution of the stochastic problem to be obtained directly from the deterministic model without requiring modification of the governing equations.
Titulo: Calculation of premixed combustion within inert porous media with model parametric uncertainty quantification

Sentencas: Quantification of uncertainty is investigated in a one-dimensional model for premixed combustion within inert porous media.
Titulo: Calculation of premixed combustion within inert porous media with model parametric uncertainty quantification

Sentencas: The model includes detailed chemistry and solves the gas- and solid-phase energy balances coupled by convective heat exchange, including radiative heat transfer in the solid-phase.
Titulo: Calculation of premixed combustion within inert porous media with model parametric uncertainty quantification

Sentencas: The results denote that the uncertainties in the porous media heat transfer parameters are relevant and originate a relatively high error bar on the CO emission and burning velocity.
Titulo: Calculation of premixed combustion within inert porous media with model parametric uncertainty quantification

Sentencas: When the inlet reactant mixture uncertain conditions is also accounted for, it overcomes the influence of the other uncertain parameters on the gas- and solid-phase temperatures error bar.
Titulo: Calculation of premixed combustion within inert porous media with model parametric uncertainty quantification

Sentencas: Both types of parametric uncertainty sources (inlet conditions and porous media parameters) are important in order to establish the error bar on the CO emission and burning velocity predictions.
Titulo: Calculation of premixed combustion within inert porous media with model parametric uncertainty quantification
